page.title: 17Atlantic College Newspaper
page.content: During the academic year 1984-5 a completely fresh attempt has been undertaken to revive the student made newspaper at Atlantic College.The editorial committee headed by Colin Jenkin,the deputy headmaster,decided to mark the rebirth by a change of name.Not FOGHORN as previous but now as KLAXON.This is a very suitable name since the college's rescue service relies on the sound of the klaxon. The students like their newspaper very much.All 360 students have subscribed to the first five issues. The circulation of 500 allows for copies to be sent to all five sister colleges.A large share of the coverage of KLAXON is dedicated to report on the United World Colleges.It is hoped that the newspaper will help build ties with the other colleges.
